verses.verse: Cast <S%H7971><s%> your bread <S%H3899><s%> upon <S%H6440><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%>: for you shall find <S%H4672><s%> it after many <S%H7230><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>.
Give <S%H5414><s%> a portion <S%H2506><s%> to seven <S%H7651><s%>, and also to eight <S%H8083><s%>; for you know <S%H3045><s%> not what evil <S%H7451><s%> shall be upon the earth <S%H776><s%>.

If the clouds <S%H5645><s%> be full <S%H4390><s%> of rain <S%H1653><s%>, they empty <S%H7324><s%> themselves upon the earth <S%H776><s%>: and if the tree <S%H6086><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> toward the south <S%H1864><s%>, or toward the north <S%H6828><s%>, in the place <S%H4725><s%> where the tree <S%H6086><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%>, there it shall be <S%H1933><s%>.
He that observes <S%H8104><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> shall not sow <S%H2232><s%>; and he that regards <S%H7200><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> shall not reap <S%H7114><s%>.

As you know <S%H3045><s%> not what is the way <S%H1870><s%> of the spirit <S%H7307><s%>, nor how the bones <S%H6106><s%> do grow in the womb <S%H990><s%> of her that is with child <S%H4392><s%>: even so you know <S%H3045><s%> not the works <S%H4639><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> who makes all <S%H6213><s%>.

In the morning <S%H1242><s%> sow <S%H2232><s%> your seed <S%H2233><s%>, and in the evening <S%H6153><s%> withhold <S%H3240><s%> not your hand <S%H3027><s%>: for you know <S%H3045><s%> not whether <S%H335><s%> shall prosper <S%H3787><s%>, either this or that <S%H8147><s%>, or whether they both shall be alike <S%H259><s%> good <S%H2896><s%>.
Truly the light <S%H216><s%> is sweet <S%H4966><s%>, and a pleasant <S%H2896><s%> thing it is for the eyes <S%H5869><s%> to behold <S%H7200><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%>:

But if a man <S%H120><s%> live <S%H2421><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in them all <S%H2142><s%>; yet let him remember the days <S%H3117><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%>; for they shall be many <S%H7235><s%>. All that comes <S%H935><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

Rejoice <S%H8055><s%>, O young man <S%H970><s%>, in your youth <S%H3208><s%>; and let your heart <S%H3820><s%> cheer <S%H2895><s%> you in the days <S%H3117><s%> of your youth <S%H979><s%>, and walk <S%H1980><s%> in the ways <S%H1870><s%> of your heart <S%H3820><s%>, and in the sight <S%H4758><s%> of your eyes <S%H5869><s%>: but know <S%H3045><s%> you <S%H430><s%>, that for all these things God will bring <S%H935><s%> you into judgment <S%H4941><s%>.

Therefore remove <S%H5493><s%> sorrow <S%H3708><s%> from your heart <S%H3820><s%>, and put away <S%H5674><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> from your flesh <S%H1320><s%>: for childhood <S%H3208><s%> and youth <S%H7839><s%> are vanity <S%H1892><s%>.
